data.title: UEFA Bans Turkish Fans From Armenia-Turkey Football Game In Yerevan On March 25, Citing Security Concerns ➖➖➖ UEFA, Europe’s football...
data.meta_description:
3,329 likes, 121 comments - zartonkmedia on March 8, 2023: "UEFA Bans Turkish Fans From Armenia-Turkey Football Game In Yerevan On March 25, Citing Security Concerns
➖➖➖
UEFA, Europe’s football governing body, has banned Turkish fans, citing security concerns, from attending an upcoming match in Yerevan’s Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium on March 25, 2023, between Armenia’s and Turkey’s national soccer teams, reports Azatutyun.

Armenia, Turkey, Croatia, Wales, and Latvia were drawn into Group D of the qualifying tournament for the 2024 UEFA European Championship that will take place in Germany.

The Armenia-Turkey qualifying match will take place on March 25, 2023, at 9:00 pm Yerevan time (9:00 am PST) at Yerevan’s Vazgen Sargsyan Republican Stadium.

On Tuesday, the Football Federation of Armenia (FFA) confirmed that UEFA ordered it not to sell tickets to traveling Turkish fans to avoid “unnecessary tension” during the game. For the same reason, Armenian fans will be barred from the second Euro 2024 qualifier between the two teams, which will be played in Turkey in September.

An FFA spokesperson said UEFA imposed the bans at its own initiative. Neither the Armenian nor the Turkish football federation had requested such a measure.

Armenia and Turkey played each other for the first time in Yerevan in 2008. That match was attended by then-Turkish President Abdullah Gul and a few Turkish fans.

Gul’s trip to Yerevan marked the beginning of a rapprochement between the two nations that nearly led to the normalization of their historically strained relations. Then Armenian President Serzh Sarkisian flew to Turkey a year later to watch a second game between the two teams.".
